intro: Plagiostyles africana, commonly known as the African plagiostyles, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a composite head. Plagiostyles africana is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
